seniority_level.evidence: 1+ years of business hands-on experience with AI models mentioned, but title is 'AI Data Engineer' without explicit seniority qualifier. Responsibilities align with mid-level expectations (e.g., deploying models, collaborating with seniors).

job_family.evidence: Title includes 'AI Data Engineer' and core focus is on preparing data for AI/ML model training, deploying AI models, and working with AI model APIs (LLMs, Computer Vision).

sub_specialty.evidence: Deploying and monitoring AI models on Microsoft Azure, automating workflows, and integrating APIs suggest a focus on MLOps.

leadership_expectation.evidence: Role is described as hands-on with no mention of direct reports, hiring, or reviews. Focus is on execution and collaboration with senior team members.

primary_cloud.evidence: Azure services (Azure ML, Microsoft Fabric) and Azure DevOps explicitly mentioned.

secondary_clouds.evidence: No other cloud providers mentioned beyond Azure.

processing_paradigm.evidence: Mentions 'data pipelines' and 'automation' which could imply batch processing, but also 'deploying AI models' which may involve real-time or hybrid paradigms. No explicit tools for streaming (e.g., Kafka, Flink) mentioned.

orchestrator_category.evidence: Azure DevOps mentioned, which is a cloud-native orchestrator for CI/CD and workflow automation.

storage_layer.evidence: No explicit mention of storage tools or paradigms (e.g., warehouse, lake, lakehouse).

remote_restriction.evidence: Location specified as 'Prague, Prague, Czechia' with hybrid work model, suggesting preference for candidates in the same region (Czechia/Prague).

timezone_focus.evidence: Location is Prague, Czechia, and no global or multi-timezone team distribution mentioned.

relocation_required.evidence: Hybrid work model and location requirement imply candidate must already be in Czechia/Prague, no relocation package mentioned.

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: No mention of OPT/CPT or student visa eligibility, and location is restricted to Czechia.

citizenship_required.evidence: No explicit discussion of citizenship or work authorization requirements beyond location (Prague, Czechia).

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Full-time employee position stated with benefits like paid vacation, pension insurance, and meal allowance.

benefits_level.evidence: Benefits mentioned include flexible working hours, hybrid work, paid vacation, meal allowance, and insurance contributions (pension, life, accident). No equity or premium perks like unlimited PTO or learning budgets.

growth_path_clarity.evidence: Mentions 'Focus on your development' and 'internal&external trainings, certifications, workshops' but no explicit career tracks or promotion ladder.

mentorship_signals.evidence: Collaboration with 'senior AI developer' and 'AI Tech Lead' suggests mentorship opportunities.

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No explicit mention of promotions or advancement paths.

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: No discussion of internal mobility or lateral moves.

career_tracks_available.evidence: Role is hands-on and mentions 'Boost your Potential and Independence' which aligns with IC track, but no explicit tracks discussed.

requirement_strictness.evidence: Clear distinction between required skills (Python, SQL, Azure) and no nice-to-haves listed, but tone is welcoming and not overly strict.

scope_definition.evidence: Job description focuses on specific responsibilities like data transformation for AI, model deployment, and API integration.

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: 1+ years of experience with AI models is reasonable for a mid-level role, and skills align with expectations.
